opc-datasource-image-list-entry.body:
data "opc_compute_image_list_entry" "$1" {
    # version - (Required) - The version (integer) of the Image List to use.
    version = ""

    # image_list - (Required) - The name of the image list to lookup.
    image_list = ""

    # entry - (Optional) - Which machine image to use. See [Entry](#entry) below for more details
    entry = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "dns" - Array of DNS servers for the interface.
    # "attributes" - JSON object of all of the image list's attributes
    # "machine_images" - An array of machine images as strings
    # "uri" - The URI of the image list
}
opc-datasource-image-list-entry.description: Use this data source to access the configuration of an Image List Entry.

opc-datasource-ip-address-reservation.body:
data "opc_compute_ip_address_reservation" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the ip address reservation.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ip_address_pool" - The IP address pool from which the IP address is allocated.
    # "description" - A description of the ip address reservation.
    # "tags" - List of tags that applied to the IP address reservation.
    # "ip_address" - The reserved IPv4 Public IP address.
    # "uri" - The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address reservation
}
opc-datasource-ip-address-reservation.description: Use this data source to access the attributes of an existing IP Network IP Address Reservation.

opc-datasource-ip-reservation.body:
data "opc_compute_ip_reservation" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) Name of the IP Reservation.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ip" - The reserved IPv4 Public IP address.
    # "permanent" - Whether the IP address remains reserved even when it is no longer associated with an instance.
    # "parent_pool" - The pool from which to allocate the IP address.
    # "tags" - List of tags applied to the IP reservation.
    # "used" - indicates that the IP reservation is associated with an instance.
}
opc-datasource-ip-reservation.description: Use this data source to access the attributes of an existing Shared Network IP Reservation.

opc-datasource-machine-image.body:
data "opc_compute_machine_image" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the Machine Image.
    name = ""

    # account - (Required) The two part name of the compute object storage account in the format `/Compute-{identity_domain}/cloud_storage`
    account = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "file" - The name of the Machine Image .tar.gz file in the "compute_images" storage container.
    # "description" - A description of the Machine Image.
    # "attributes" - An optional JSON object of arbitrary attributes to be made available to the instance. These are user-defined tags. After defining attributes, you can view them from within an instance at http://192.0.0.192/
    # "error_reason" - Description of the state of the machine image if there is an error.
    # "hypervisor" -  Dictionary of hypervisor-specific attributes.
    # "image_format" - The format of the image.
    # "platform" - The OS platform of the image.
    # "state" - The state of the uploaded machine image.
    # "uri" - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Machine Image.
}
opc-datasource-machine-image.description: Use this data source to access the configuration of an Machine Image.

opc-datasource-network-interface.body:
data "opc_compute_network_interface" "$1" {
    # instance_name - (Optional) `instance_name` is the name of the instance.
    instance_name = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) `instance_id` is the id of the instance.
    instance_id = ""

    # interface - (Optional) `interface` is the name of the attached interface. `eth0`, `eth1`, ... `eth9`.
    interface = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "dns" - Array of DNS servers for the interface.
    # "ip_address" - IP Address assigned to the interface.
    # "ip_network" - The IP Network assigned to the interface.
    # "is_default_gateway" - Whether or not the the interface is the default gateway.
    # "mac_address" - The MAC address of the interface.
    # "model" - The model of the NIC card used.
    # "name_servers" - Array of name servers for the interface.
    # "nat" - The IP Reservation (in IP Networks) associated with the interface.
    # "search_domains" - The search domains that are sent through DHCP as option 119.
    # "sec_lists" - The security lists the interface is added to.
    # "shared_network" - Whether or not the interface is inside the Shared Network or an IP Network.
    # "vnic" - The name of the vNIC created for the IP Network.
    # "vnic_sets" - The array of vNIC Sets the interface was added to.
}
opc-datasource-network-interface.description: Use this data source to access the configuration of an instance's network interface

opc-datasource-ssh-key.body:
data "opc_compute_ssh_key" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The unique (within this identity domain) name of the SSH key.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "key" - The public SSH key.
    # "enabled" - Whether or not the key is enabled.
}
opc-datasource-ssh-key.description: Use this data source to access the attributes of an SSH Key.

opc-datasource-storage-volume-snapshot.body:
data "opc_compute_storage_volume_snapshot" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) `name` is the name of the storage volume snapshot.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "account" - Account of the snapshot.
    # "collocated" - Boolean specifying whether the snapshot is collocated or remote.
    # "description" - The description of the storage volume snapshot.
    # "machine_image_name" - The name of the machine image that's used in the boot volume from which this snapshot is taken.
    # "parent_volume_bootable" - Boolean specifying whether or not the snapshot's parent volume was bootable.
    # "property" - Where the snapshot is stored, whether collocated, or in the Oracle Storage Cloud Service instance.
    # "platform" - The OS platform this snapshot is compatible with
    # "size" - The size of the snapshot in GB.
    # "snapshot_timestamp" - Timestamp of the storage snapshot, generated by storage server. The snapshot will contain data written to the original volume before this time.
    # "snapshot_id" - The Oracle ID of the snapshot.
    # "start_timestamp" - Timestamp when the snapshot was started.
    # "status" - Status of the snapshot.
    # "status_detail" - Details about the latest state of the storage volume snapshot.
    # "status_timestamp" - Indicates the time that the current view of the storage volume snapshot was generated.
    # "tags" - Comma-separated strings that tag the storage volume.
    # "uri" - Uniform Resource Identifier
    # "volume_name" - The name of the storage volume that the snapshot was created from
}
opc-datasource-storage-volume-snapshot.description: Use this data source to access the configuration of a storage volume snapshot.

opc-datasource-vnic.body:
data "opc_compute_vnic" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) `name` is the name of the Virtual NIC.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "description" is a description of the Virtual NIC.
    # "mac_address" is the MAC Address of the Virtual NIC.
    # "tags" is a list of Tags associated with the Virtual NIC.
    # "transit_flag" is "true" if the Virtual NIC is of the type "transit".
    # "uri" is the Unique Resource Locator of the Virtual NIC.
}
opc-datasource-vnic.description: Use this data source to access the configuration of a Virtual NIC.

opc-resource-acl.body:
resource "opc_compute_acl" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the ACL.
    name = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Enables or disables the ACL. Set to true by default.
    enabled = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the ACL.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ACL.
    tags = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier for the ACL
    uri = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ACL.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-acl.description: The ``opc_compute_acl`` resource creates and manages an ACL in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-image-list-entry.body:
resource "opc_compute_image_list_entry" "$1" {
    # version - (Required) The unique version of the image list entry, as an integer.
    version = ""

    # machine_images - (Required) An array of machine images.
    machine_images = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Image List.
    name = ""

    # attributes - (Optional) JSON String of optional data that will be passed to an instance of this machine image when it is launched.
    attributes = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "uri" - The Unique Resource Identifier for the Image List Entry.
    # "attributes" - (Optional) JSON String of optional data that will be passed to an instance of this machine image when it is launched.
}
opc-resource-image-list-entry.description: The ``opc_compute_image_list_entry`` resource creates and manages an Image List Entry in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-image-list-type.body:
resource "opc_compute_image_list" "$1" {
    # default - (Required) The image list entry to be used, by default, when launching instances using this image list. Defaults to `1`.
    default = ""

    # description - (Required) A description of the Image List.
    description = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Image List.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-image-list-type.description: The ``opc_compute_image_list`` resource creates and manages an Image List in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-instance.body:
resource "opc_compute_instance" "$1" {
    # shape - (Required) The shape of the instance, e.g. `oc4`.
    shape = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the instance.
    name = ""

    # instance_attributes - (Optional) A JSON string of custom attributes. See [Attributes](#attributes) below for more information.
    instance_attributes = ""

    # boot_order - (Optional) The index number of the bootable storage volume, presented as a list, that should be used to boot the instance. The only valid value is `[1]`. If you set this attribute, you must also specify a bootable storage volume with index number 1 in the volume sub-parameter of storage_attachments. When you specify boot_order, you don't need to specify the imagelist attribute, because the instance is booted using the image on the specified bootable storage volume. If you specify both boot_order and imagelist, the imagelist attribute is ignored.
    boot_order = ""

    # hostname - (Optional) The host name assigned to the instance. On an Oracle Linux instance, this host name is displayed in response to the hostname command. Only relative DNS is supported. The domain name is suffixed to the host name that you specify. The host name must not end with a period. If you don't specify a host name, then a name is generated automatically.
    hostname = ""

    # image_list - (Optional) The imageList of the instance, e.g. `/oracle/public/oel_6.4_2GB_v1`.
    image_list = ""

    # label - (Optional) The label to apply to the instance.
    label = ""

    # desired_state - (Optional) Set the desire state of the instance to `running` (default) or `shutdown`. You can use this request to shut down and restart individual instances which use a persistent bootable storage volume.
    desired_state = ""

    # networking_info - (Optional) Information pertaining to an individual network interface to be created and attached to the instance. If left unspecified, the instance will be created within the `shared_network`. See [Networking Info](#networking-info) below for more information.
    networking_info = ""

    # storage - (Optional) Information pertaining to an individual storage attachment to be created during instance creation. Please see [Storage Attachments](#storage-attachments) below for more information.
    storage = ""

    # reverse_dns - (Optional) If set to `true` (default), then reverse DNS records are created. If set to `false`, no reverse DNS records are created.
    reverse_dns = ""

    # ssh_keys - (Optional) A list of the names of the SSH Keys that can be used to log into the instance.
    ssh_keys = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The "id" of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "attributes" - The full attributes of the instance, as a JSON string.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "availability_domain" - The availability domain the instance is in.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "domain" - The default domain to use for the hostname and for DNS lookups.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "entry" - Imagelist entry number.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "fingerprint" - SSH server fingerprint presented by the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "fqdn" - The fully qualified domain name of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "image_format" - The format of the image.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "ip_address" - The IP Address of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "placement_requirements" - The array of placement requirements for the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "platform" - The OS Platform of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "priority" - The priority at which the instance was ran.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "quota_reservation" - Reference to the QuotaReservation, to be destroyed with the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "relationships" - The array of relationship specifications to be satisfied on instance placement.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "resolvers" - Array of resolvers to be used instead of the default resolvers.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "site" - The site the instance is running on.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "start_time" - The launch time of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "state" - The instance's state.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "vcable_id" - vCable ID for the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "virtio" - Boolean that determines if the instance is a virtio device.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
    # "vnc_address" - The VNC address and port of the instance.
    # "tags" - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.
}
opc-resource-instance.description:
The ``opc_compute_instance`` resource creates and manages an instance in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain. ~> **Caution:** The ``opc_compute_instance`` resource can completely delete your
instance just as easily as it can create it. To avoid costly accidents,
consider setting
[``prevent_destroy``](/docs/configuration/resources.html#prevent_destroy)
on your instance resources as an extra safety measure.

opc-resource-ip-address-association.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_address_association" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the ip address association.
    name = ""

    # ip_address_reservation - (Optional) The name of the NAT IP address reservation.
    ip_address_reservation = ""

    # vnic - (Optional) The name of the virtual NIC associated with this NAT IP reservation.
    vnic = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the ip address association.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address association.
    tags = ""

    # uri - (Optional) (Computed) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address association.
    uri = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address association.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-ip-address-association.description: The ``opc_compute_ip_address_association`` resource creates and manages an IP address association between an IP address reservation and a virtual NIC in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain, for an IP Network.

opc-resource-ip-address-prefix-set.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_address_prefix_set" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the ip address prefix set.
    name = ""

    # prefixes - (Optional) List of CIDR IPv4 prefixes assigned in the virtual network.
    prefixes = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the ip address prefix set.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address prefix set.
    tags = ""

    # uri - (Optional) (Computed) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address prefix set.
    uri = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address prefix set.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-ip-address-prefix-set.description: The ``opc_compute_ip_address_prefix_set`` resource creates and manages an IP address prefix set in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-ip-address-reservation.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_address_reservation" "$1" {
    # ip_address_pool - (Required) The IP address pool from which you want to reserve an IP address. Typically one of either `public-ippool` or `cloud-ippool`.
    ip_address_pool = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the ip address reservation.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the ip address reservation.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP address reservation.
    tags = ""

    # ip_address - (Optional) Reserved NAT IPv4 address from the IP address pool.
    ip_address = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address reservation
    uri = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-ip-address-reservation.description: The ``opc_compute_ip_address_reservation`` resource creates and manages an IP address reservation in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain, for an IP Network.

opc-resource-ip-association.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_association" "$1" {
    # parent_pool - (Required) The pool from which to take an IP address. To associate a specific reserved IP address, use the prefix `ipreservation:` followed by the name of the IP reservation. To allocate an IP address from a pool, use the prefix `ippool:`, e.g. `ippool:/oracle/public/ippool`.
    parent_pool = ""

    # vcable - (Required) The vcable of the instance to associate the IP address with.
    vcable = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" The name of the IP Association
    # "parent_pool" - (Required) The pool from which to take an IP address. To associate a specific reserved IP address, use the prefix "ipreservation:" followed by the name of the IP reservation. To allocate an IP address from a pool, use the prefix "ippool:", e.g. "ippool:/oracle/public/ippool".
}
opc-resource-ip-association.description:
The ``opc_compute_ip_association`` resource creates and manages an association between an IP address and an instance in
an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain, for the Shared Network.

opc-resource-ip-network.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_network" "$1" {
    # ip_address_prefix - (Required) The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format.
    ip_address_prefix = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the IP Network. Changing this name forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the IP Network.
    description = ""

    # ip_network_exchange - (Optional) Specify the IP Network exchange to which the IP Network belongs to.
    ip_network_exchange = ""

    # public_napt_enabled - (Optional) If true, enable public internet access using NAPT for VNICs without any public IP Reservation. Defaults to `false`.
    public_napt_enabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" - The name of the IP Network
    # "ip_address_prefix" - The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format.
    # "description" - The description of the IP Network.
    # "ip_network_exchange" - The IP Network Exchange for the IP Network
    # "public_napt_enabled" - Whether public internet access using NAPT for VNICs without any public IP Reservation or not.
    # "uri" - Uniform Resource Identifier for the IP Network
}
opc-resource-ip-network.description: The ``opc_compute_ip_network`` resource creates and manages an IP Network in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-ip-network-exchange.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_network_exchange" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the ip network exchange.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the ip network exchange.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP network exchange.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-ip-network-exchange.description: The `opc_compute_ip_network_exchange` resource creates and manages an IP network exchange in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-ip-reservation.body:
resource "opc_compute_ip_reservation" "$1" {
    # permanent - (Required) Whether the IP address remains reserved even when it is no longer associated with an instance (if true), or may be returned to the pool and replaced with a different IP address when an instance is restarted, or deleted and recreated (if false).
    permanent = ""

    # parent_pool - (Optional) The pool from which to allocate the IP address. Defaults to `/oracle/public/ippool`, and is currently the only acceptable input.
    parent_pool = ""

    # name - (Optional) Name of the IP Reservation. Will be generated if unspecified.
    name = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP reservation.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ip" - The Public IP address.
    # "used" - indicates that the IP reservation is associated with an instance.
}
opc-resource-ip-reservation.description: The ``opc_compute_ip_reservation`` resource creates and manages an IP reservation in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain for the Shared Network.

opc-resource-lbaas-certificate.body:
resource "opc_lbaas_certificate" "$1" {
    # type - (Required) Sets the Certificate Type. `TRUSTED` or `SERVER`.
    type = ""

    # certificate_body - (Required) The Certificate data in PEM format.
    certificate_body = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Certificate.
    name = ""

    # certificate_chain - (Optional) PEM encoded bodies of all certificates in the chain up to and including the CA certificate. This is not need when the certificate is self signed.
    certificate_chain = ""

    # private_key - (Optional) The private key data in PEM format. Only required for Server Certificates
    private_key = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-lbaas-certificate.description: The `opc_lbaas_certificate` resource creates and manages an Load Balancer Classic TLS/SSL Digital Certificate. Server certificates are used to secure the connection between clients and the load balancers. Trusted certificates are used to secure the connection between the load balancer and the origin servers in the server pool.

opc-resource-lbaas-load-balancer.body:
resource "opc_lbaas_load_balancer" "$1" {
    # region - (Required) The region in which to create the Load Balancer, e.g. `uscom-central-1`
    region = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Load Balancer.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A short description for the load balancer. The description must not exceed 1000 characters.
    description = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Load Balancer. Default is `true` (enabled).
    enabled = ""

    # ip_network - (Optional) Fully qualified three part name of the IP network to be associated with the load balancer.
    ip_network = ""

    # parent_load_balancer - (Optional) Select a parent load balancer if you want to create a dependent load balancer.
    parent_load_balancer = ""

    # permitted_clients - (Optional) List of permitted client IP addresses or CIDR ranges which can connect to this load balancer on the configured Listener ports. If not set all connections are permitted.
    permitted_clients = ""

    # permitted_methods - (Optional) List of permitted HTTP methods. e.g. `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH`, `DELETE`, `HEAD` or you can also create your own custom methods. Requests with methods not listed in this field will result in a 403 (unauthorized access) response.
    permitted_methods = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-lbaas-load-balancer.description: The `opc_lbaas_load_balancer` resource creates and manages a Load Balancer Classic instance in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic Compute region. You must define server pools, create at least one listener, and optionally define the policies for the load balancer before it will be operational.

opc-resource-lbaas-policy.body:
resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "$1" {
    # load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Listener.
    load_balancer = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Listener.
    name = ""

    # application_cookie_stickiness_policy - (Optional) see [Application Cookie Stickiness Policy](#application-cookie-stickiness-policy)
    application_cookie_stickiness_policy = ""

    # cloudgate_policy - (Optional) see [CloudGate Policy](#cloudgate-policy)
    cloudgate_policy = ""

    # load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy - (Optional) see [Load Balancer Cookie Stickiness Policy](#load-balancer-cookie-stickiness-policy)
    load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy = ""

    # load_balancing_mechanism_policy - (Optional) see [Load Balancing Mechanism Policy](#load-balancing-mechanism-policy)
    load_balancing_mechanism_policy = ""

    # rate_limiting_request_policy - (Optional) see [Rate Limiting Request Policy](#rate-limiting-request-policy)
    rate_limiting_request_policy = ""

    # redirect_policy - (Optional) see [Redirect Policy](#redirect-policy)
    redirect_policy = ""

    # resource_access_control_policy - (Optional) see [Resource Access Control Policy](#resource-access-control-policy)
    resource_access_control_policy = ""

    # set_request_header_policy - (Optional) see [Set Request Header Policy](#set-request-header-policy)
    set_request_header_policy = ""

    # ssl_negotiation_policy - (Optional) see [SSL Negotiation Policy](#set-negotiation-policy)
    ssl_negotiation_policy = ""

    # trusted_certificate_policy - (Optional) see [Trusted Certificate Policy](#trusted-certificate-policy)
    trusted_certificate_policy = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-lbaas-policy.description: The `opc_lbaas_policy` resource creates and manages a Load Balancer Classic Policy for a Load Balancer Classic instance. The Policy resource supports the definition of distinct Policy types: [Application Cookie Stickiness Policy](#application-cookie-stickiness-policy)  [CloudGate Policy](#cloudgate-policy)  [Load Balancer Cookie Stickiness Policy](#load-balancer-cookie-stickiness-policy)  [Load Balancing Mechanism Policy](#load-balancing-mechanism-policy)  [Rate Limiting Request Policy](#rate-limiting-request-policy)  [Redirect Policy](#redirect-policy)  [Resource Access Control Policy](#resource-access-control-policy)  [Set Request Header Policy](#set-request-header-policy)  [SSL Negotiation Policy](#set-negotiation-policy)  [Trusted Certificate Policy](#trusted-certificate-policy)

opc-resource-lbaas-server-pool.body:
resource "opc_lbaas_server_pool" "$1" {
    # servers - (Required) List of servers in the Server Pool. To define the server in the server pool, provide IP address or DNS name of the compute instances, and port for load balancer to direct traffic to, in the format `host:port`
    servers = ""

    # load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Origin Server Pool.
    load_balancer = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Server Pool.
    name = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Server Pool. Default is `true` (enabled).
    enabled = ""

    # health_check - (Optional) Enables Load Balancer health check, see [Health Check Attributes](#health-check-attributes)
    health_check = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags.
    tags = ""

    # vnic_set - (Optional) Fully qualified three part name of a vNICSet to be associated with the server pool vNIC. Load Balancer uses this vNICSet to set the right ACLs to allow egress traffic from the load balancer.
    vnic_set = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-lbaas-server-pool.description: The `opc_lbaas_server_pool` resource creates and manages a Load Balancer Classic Origin Server Pool for a Load Balancer Classic instance. The Server Pool defines one or more servers (referred to as origin servers) to which the load balancer can distribute requests.

opc-resource-machine-image.body:
resource "opc_compute_machine_image" "$1" {
    # file - (Required) The name of the Machine Image .tar.gz file in the `compute_images` storage container.
    file = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Machine Image.
    name = ""

    # account - (Required) The two part name of the compute object storage account in the format `/Compute-{identity_domain}/cloud_storage`
    account = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the Machine Image.
    description = ""

    # attributes - (Optional) An optional JSON object of arbitrary attributes to be made available to the instance. These are user-defined tags. After defining attributes, you can view them from within an instance at http://192.0.0.192/
    attributes = ""

    # error_reason - (Optional) Description of the state of the machine image if there is an error.
    error_reason = ""

    # hypervisor - (Optional)  Dictionary of hypervisor-specific attributes.
    hypervisor = ""

    # image_format - (Optional) The format of the image.
    image_format = ""

    # platform - (Optional) The OS platform of the image.
    platform = ""

    # state - (Optional) The state of the uploaded machine image.
    state = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Machine Image.
    uri = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-machine-image.description: The ``opc_compute_machine_image`` resource creates and manages a machine image template of a virtual hard disk of a specific size with an installed operating system. Before performing this creating the Machine Image, you must upload your machine image file to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic `compute_images` container

opc-resource-opc-lbaas-listener.body:
resource "opc_lbaas_listener" "$1" {
    # server_protocol - (Required) The protocol to be used for routing traffic to the origin servers in the server pool. `HTTP` or `HTTPS`. If set to `HTTPS` then you must include a Trusted Certificate Policy in the `policies`
    server_protocol = ""

    # port - (Required) The port on which the Load Balancer is listening.
    port = ""

    # balancer_protocol - (Required)  transport protocol that will be accepted for all incoming requests to the selected load balancer listener. `HTTP` or `HTTPS`. If set to HTTPS then you must also set the server `certificates`.
    balancer_protocol = ""

    # load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Listener.
    load_balancer = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Listener.
    name = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Listener. Default is `true` (enabled).
    enabled = ""

    # path_prefixes - (Optional) List of paths to configure the listener to accept only requests that are targeted to a specific path within the URI of the request.
    path_prefixes = ""

    # polices - (Optional) List of the Load Balancer Policy URIs to apply to the listener.
    polices = ""

    # server_pool - (Optional) URI of the Server Pool resource to which the load balancer distributes requests.
    server_pool = ""

    # certificates - (Optional) The URI of the server security certificate.
    certificates = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags.
    tags = ""

    # virtual_hosts - (Optional) Configure the listener to only accept URI requests that include the host names listed in this field.
    virtual_hosts = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-opc-lbaas-listener.description: The `opc_lbaas_listener` resource creates and manages a Load Balancer Classic Listener for a Load Balancer Classic instance.

opc-resource-orchestrated-instance.body:
resource "opc_compute_orchestrated_instance" "$1" {
    # instance - (Required) The information pertaining to creating an instance through the orchestration API.
    instance = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the orchestration.
    name = ""

    # active - (Optional) `active`: all resource (instances) declared in the orchestration are created
    active = ""

    # suspend - (Optional) `suspend`: all resources (instances) declared in the orchestration are removed unless the instances has `persistent = true`
    suspend = ""

    # inactive - (Optional) `inactive`:  all resources (instances) declared in the orchestration are removed including the instances that have `persistent = true`
    inactive = ""

    # inactive - (Optional) `inactive`:  all resources (instances) declared in the orchestration are removed including the instances that have `persistent = true`
    inactive = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the orchestration.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-orchestrated-instance.description:
The `opc_compute_orchestrated_instance` resource creates and manages an orchestration containing a number of
instances in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-route.body:
resource "opc_compute_route" "$1" {
    # next_hop_vnic_set - (Required) Name of the virtual NIC set to route matching packets to. Routed flows are load-balanced among all the virtual NICs in the virtual NIC set.
    next_hop_vnic_set = ""

    # ip_address_prefix - (Required) The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format, of the external network from which to route traffic.
    ip_address_prefix = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the route.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the route.
    description = ""

    # admin_distance - (Optional) The route's administrative distance. Defaults to `0`.
    admin_distance = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "name" The name of the route
    # "description" - The description of the route.
    # "admin_distance" - The route's administrative distance. Defaults to "0".
    # "ip_address_prefix" - The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format, of the external network from which to route traffic.
    # "next_hop_vnic_set" - Name of the virtual NIC set to route matching packets to. Routed flows are load-balanced among all the virtual NICs in the virtual NIC set.
}
opc-resource-route.description: The `opc_compute_route` resource creates and manages a route for an IP Network in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-sec-rule.body:
resource "opc_compute_sec_rule" "$1" {
    # action - (Required) Whether to `permit`, `refuse` or `deny` packets to which this rule applies. This will ordinarily be `permit`.
    action = ""

    # application - (Required) The name of the application to which the rule applies.
    application = ""

    # source_list - (Required) The source security list (prefixed with `seclist:`), or security IP list (prefixed with `seciplist:`). `destination_list` - (Required) The destination security list (prefixed with `seclist:`), or security IP list (prefixed with `seciplist:`).
    source_list = ""

    # source_list - (Required) The source security list (prefixed with `seclist:`), or security IP list (prefixed with `seciplist:`). `destination_list` - (Required) The destination security list (prefixed with `seclist:`), or security IP list (prefixed with `seciplist:`).
    source_list = ""

    # name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the security rule.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for this security rule.
    description = ""

    # disabled - (Optional) Whether to disable this security rule. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable a rule without removing it outright from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to `false`.
    disabled = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the sec rule.
    uri = ""

    # disabled - (Optional) Whether to disable this security rule. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable a rule without removing it outright from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to `false`.
    disabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-sec-rule.description: The ``opc_compute_sec_rule`` resource creates and manages a sec rule in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain, which joins together a source security list (or security IP list), a destination security list (or security IP list), and a security application.

opc-resource-security-application.body:
resource "opc_compute_security_application" "$1" {
    # dport - (Required) The port, or range of ports, to enable for this application, e.g `8080`, `6000-7000`. This must be set if the `protocol` is set to `tcp` or `udp`.
    dport = ""

    # protocol - (Required) The protocol to enable for this application. Must be one of `tcp`, `udp`, `ah`, `esp`, `icmp`, `icmpv6`, `igmp`, `ipip`, `gre`, `mplsip`, `ospf`, `pim`, `rdp`, `sctp` or `all`.
    protocol = ""

    # name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the application
    name = ""

    # icmptype - (Optional) The ICMP type to enable for this application, if the `protocol` is `icmp`. Must be one of `echo`, `reply`, `ttl`, `traceroute`, `unreachable`.
    icmptype = ""

    # icmpcode - (Optional) The ICMP code to enable for this application, if the `protocol` is `icmp`. Must be one of `admin`, `df`, `host`, `network`, `port` or `protocol`.
    icmpcode = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-security-application.description: The ``opc_compute_security_application`` resource creates and manages a security application in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-security-association.body:
resource "opc_compute_security_association" "$1" {
    # seclist - (Required) The name of the security list to associate the instance to.
    seclist = ""

    # vcable - (Required) The `vcable` of the instance to associate to the security list.
    vcable = ""

    # name - (Optional) The Name for the Security Association. If not specified, one is created automatically. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-security-association.description:
The ``opc_compute_security_association`` resource creates and manages an association between an instance and a security
list in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-security-list.body:
resource "opc_compute_security_list" "$1" {
    # output_cidr_policy - (Required) The policy for outbound traffic from the security list. Must be one of `permit`, `reject` (packets are dropped but a reply is sent) and `deny` (packets are dropped and no reply is sent).
    output_cidr_policy = ""

    # policy - (Required) The policy to apply to instances associated with this list. Must be one of `permit`, `reject` (packets are dropped but a reply is sent) and `deny` (packets are dropped and no reply is sent).
    policy = ""

    # name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the security list.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-security-list.description: The ``opc_compute_security_list`` resource creates and manages a security list in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-security-protocol.body:
resource "opc_compute_security_protocol" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the security protocol.
    name = ""

    # dst_ports - (Optional) Enter a list of port numbers or port range strings. 	Traffic is enabled by a security rule when a packet's destination port matches the ports specified here. 	For TCP, SCTP, and UDP, each port is a destination transport port, between 0 and 65535, 	inclusive. For ICMP, each port is an ICMP type, between 0 and 255, inclusive. 	If no destination ports are specified, all destination ports or ICMP types are allowed.
    dst_ports = ""

    # src_ports - (Optional) Enter a list of port numbers or port range strings. 	Traffic is enabled by a security rule when a packet's source port matches the 	ports specified here. 	For TCP, SCTP, and UDP, each port is a source transport port, 	between 0 and 65535, inclusive. 	For ICMP, each port is an ICMP type, between 0 and 255, inclusive. 	If no source ports are specified, all source ports or ICMP types are allowed.
    src_ports = ""

    # ip_protocol - (Optional) The protocol used in the data portion of the IP datagram. 	 Permitted values are: tcp, udp, icmp, igmp, ipip, rdp, esp, ah, gre, icmpv6, ospf, pim, sctp, 	 mplsip, all. 	 Traffic is enabled by a security rule when the protocol in the packet matches the 	 protocol specified here. If no protocol is specified, all protocols are allowed.
    ip_protocol = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the security protocol.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security protocol.
    tags = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Security Protocol
    uri = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security protocol.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-security-protocol.description: The ``opc_compute_security_protocol`` resource creates and manages a security protocol in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-security-rule.body:
resource "opc_compute_security_rule" "$1" {
    # flow_direction - (Required) Specify the direction of flow of traffic, which is relative to the instances, for this security rule. Allowed values are ingress or egress.
    flow_direction = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the security rule.
    name = ""

    # disabled - (Optional) Whether to disable this security rule. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable a rule without removing it outright from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to `false`.
    disabled = ""

    # acl - (Optional) Name of the ACL that contains this security rule.
    acl = ""

    # dst_ip_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of IP address prefix set names to match the packet's destination IP address.
    dst_ip_address_prefixes = ""

    # src_ip_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of names of IP address prefix set to match the packet's source IP address.
    src_ip_address_prefixes = ""

    # dst_vnic_set - (Optional) Name of virtual NIC set containing the packet's destination virtual NIC.
    dst_vnic_set = ""

    # src_vnic_set - (Optional) Name of virtual NIC set containing the packet's source virtual NIC.
    src_vnic_set = ""

    # security_protocols - (Optional) List of security protocol object names to match the packet's protocol and port.
    security_protocols = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the security rule.
    description = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security rule.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "uri" - The Uniform Resource Identifier of the security rule.
    # "tags" - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security rule.
}
opc-resource-security-rule.description: The ``opc_compute_security_rule`` resource creates and manages a security rule in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-ssh-key.body:
resource "opc_compute_ssh_key" "$1" {
    # key - (Required) The SSH key itself
    key = ""

    # name - (Required) The unique (within this identity domain) name of the SSH key.
    name = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Whether or not the key is enabled. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable an SSH key, without removing it entirely from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to `true`
    enabled = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-ssh-key.description: The ``opc_compute_ssh_key`` resource creates and manages an SSH key in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-storage-container.body:
resource "opc_storage_container" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the Storage Container.
    name = ""

    # read_acls - (Optional) The list of ACLs that grant read access. See [Setting Container ACLs](#setting-container-acls).
    read_acls = ""

    # write_acls - (Optional) The list of ACLs that grant write access. See [Setting Container ACLs](#setting-container-acls).
    write_acls = ""

    # primary_key - (Optional) The primary secret key value for temporary URLs.
    primary_key = ""

    # secondary_key - (Optional) The secondary secret key value for temporary URLs.
    secondary_key = ""

    # allowed_origins - (Optional) List of origins that are allowed to make cross-origin requests.
    allowed_origins = ""

    # exposed_headers - (Optional) List of headers exposed to the user agent (e.g. browser) in the actual request response
    exposed_headers = ""

    # max_age - (Optional) Maximum age in seconds for the origin to hold the preflight results.
    max_age = ""

    # quota_bytes - (Optional) Maximum size of the container, in bytes
    quota_bytes = ""

    # quota_count - (Optional) Maximum object count of the container
    quota_count = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Additional object metadata headers. See [Container Metadata ](#container-metadata) below for more information.
    metadata = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-storage-container.description:
Creates and manages a Container in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Storage Classic service. `storage_endpoint` must be set in the
provider or environment to manage these resources.

opc-resource-storage-object.body:
resource "opc_storage_object" "$1" {
    # container - (Required) The name of Storage Container the store the object in.
    container = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the Storage Object.
    name = ""

    # content - (Optional) Raw content in string-form of the data.
    content = ""

    # file - (Optional) File path for the content to use for data.
    file = ""

    # copy_from - (Optional) name of an existing object used to create the new object as a copy. The value is in form `container/object`. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the container and object.
    copy_from = ""

    # content_disposition - (Optional) Set the HTTP `Content-Disposition` header to specify the override behaviour for the browser, e.g. `inline` or `attachment`.
    content_disposition = ""

    # content_encoding - (Optional) set the HTTP `Content-Encoding` for the object.
    content_encoding = ""

    # content_type - (Optional) set the MIME type for the object.
    content_type = ""

    # delete_at - (Optional) The date and time in UNIX Epoch time stamp format when the system removes the object.
    delete_at = ""

    # etag - (Optional) MD5 checksum value of the request body. Strongly Recommended.
    etag = ""

    # transfer_encoding - (Optional) Set to `chunked` to enable chunked transfer encoding.
    transfer_encoding = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Additional object metadata headers. See [Object Metadata ](#object-metadata) below for more information.
    metadata = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-storage-object.description: Creates and manages a Object in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Storage Classic container. `storage_endpoint` must be set in the provider or environment to manage these resources.

opc-resource-storage-volume-attachment.body:
resource "opc_compute_storage_volume_attachment" "$1" {
    # index - (Required) The index on the instance that the storage volume will be attached to.
    index = ""

    # storage_volume - (Required) The name of the storage volume that will be attached to the instance
    storage_volume = ""

    # instance - (Required) The name of the instance the volume will be attached to.
    instance = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-storage-volume-attachment.description: The `opc_compute_storage_volume_attachment` resource creates and manages a storage volume attachment in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-storage-volume-snapshot.body:
resource "opc_compute_storage_volume_snapshot" "$1" {
    # volume_name - (Required) The name of the storage volume to create the snapshot from.
    volume_name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the storage volume snapshot.
    description = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the storage volume snapshot. Will be generated if unspecified.
    name = ""

    # parent_volume_bootable - (Optional) A string value of whether or not the parent volume is 'bootable' or not. Defaults to `"false"`.
    parent_volume_bootable = ""

    # collocated - (Optional) Boolean specifying whether the snapshot is collocated or remote. Defaults to `false`.
    collocated = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Comma-separated strings that tag the storage volume.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "account" - Account to use for snapshots.
    # "machine_image_name" - The name of the machine image that's used in the boot volume from which this snapshot is taken.
    # "size" - The size of the snapshot in GB.
    # "property" - Where the snapshot is stored, whether collocated, or in the Oracle Storage Cloud Service instance.
    # "platform" - The OS platform this snapshot is compatible with
    # "snapshot_timestamp" - Timestamp of the storage snapshot, generated by storage server. The snapshot will contain data written to the original volume before this time.
    # "snapshot_id" - The Oracle ID of the snapshot.
    # "start_timestamp" - Timestamp when the snapshot was started.
    # "status" - Status of the snapshot.
    # "status_detail" - Details about the latest state of the storage volume snapshot.
    # "status_timestamp" - Indicates the time that the current view of the storage volume snapshot was generated.
    # "uri" - Uniform Resource Identifier
}
opc-resource-storage-volume-snapshot.description: The ``opc_compute_storage_volume_snapshot`` resource creates and manages a storage volume snapshot in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-storage-volume-type.body:
resource "opc_compute_storage_volume" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) The size of this storage volume in GB. The allowed range is from 1 GB to 2 TB (2048 GB).
    size = ""

    # name - (Required) The name for the Storage Account.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the storage volume.
    description = ""

    # storage_type - (Optional) - The Type of Storage to provision. Defaults to `/oracle/public/storage/default`.
    storage_type = ""

    # bootable - (Optional) Is the Volume Bootable? Defaults to `false`.
    bootable = ""

    # image_list - (Optional) Defines an image list.
    image_list = ""

    # image_list_entry - (Optional) Defines an image list entry.
    image_list_entry = ""

    # snapshot - (Optional) The name of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored or cloned. See [Snapshots](#snapshots), below for more information.
    snapshot = ""

    # snapshot_id - (Optional) The Id of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored or cloned. See [Snapshots](#snapshots), below for more information.
    snapshot_id = ""

    # snapshot_account - (Optional) The Account of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored. See [Snapshots](#snapshots), below for more information.
    snapshot_account = ""

    # tags - (Optional) Comma-separated strings that tag the storage volume.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "hypervisor" - The hypervisor that this volume is compatible with.
    # "machine_image" - Name of the Machine Image - available if the volume is a bootable storage volume.
    # "managed" - Is this a Managed Volume?
    # "platform" - The OS platform this volume is compatible with.
    # "readonly" - Can this Volume be attached as readonly?
    # "status" - The current state of the storage volume.
    # "storage_pool" - The storage pool from which this volume is allocated.
    # "uri" - Unique Resource Identifier of the Storage Volume.
}
opc-resource-storage-volume-type.description: The ``opc_compute_storage_volume`` resource creates and manages a storage volume in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain. ~> **Caution:** The ``opc_compute_storage_volume`` resource can completely delete your storage volume just as easily as it can create it. To avoid costly accidents, consider setting [``prevent_destroy``](/docs/configuration/resources.html#prevent_destroy) on your storage volume resources as an extra safety measure.

opc-resource-vnic-set.body:
resource "opc_compute_vnic_set" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The unique (within this identity domain) name of the virtual nic set.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the virtual nic set.
    description = ""

    # applied_acls - (Optional) A list of the ACLs to apply to the virtual nics in the set.
    applied_acls = ""

    # virtual_nics - (Optional) List of virtual NICs associated with this virtual NIC set.
    virtual_nics = ""

    # tags - (Optional) A list of tags to apply to the storage volume.
    tags = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-vnic-set.description: The ``opc_compute_vnic_set`` resource creates and manages a virtual NIC set in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.

opc-resource-vpn-endpoint-v2.body:
resource "opc_compute_vpn_endpoint_v2" "$1" {
    # hash - (Required) ESP Hash. `sha1`, `sha2_256` or `md5`
    hash = ""

    # encryption - (Required) ESP Encryption.  `aes128`, `aes192` or `aes256`  
    encryption = ""

    # dh_group - (Required) Diffie-Hellman group for both IKE and ESP. `group2`, `group5`, `group14`, `group22`, `group23`, or `group24`
    dh_group = ""

    # hash - (Required) IKE Hash. `sha1`, `sha2_256` or `md5`
    hash = ""

    # encryption - (Required) IKE Encryption. `aes128`, `aes192` or `aes256`  
    encryption = ""

    # vnic_sets - (Required) A list of vnic sets that traffics is allowed to and from.
    vnic_sets = ""

    # reachable_routes - (Required) A list of routes (CIDR prefixes) that are reachable through this VPN tunnel.
    reachable_routes = ""

    # pre_shared_key - (Required) The pre-shared VPN key
    pre_shared_key = ""

    # ip_network - (Required) The name of the IP network on which the cloud gateway is created by VPNaaS.
    ip_network = ""

    # customer_vpn_gateway - (Required) The ip address of the VPN gateway in your data center through which you want to connect to the Oracle Cloud VPN gateway.
    customer_vpn_gateway = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the VPN Endpoint V2.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the VPN Endpoint V2.
    description = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Enables or disables the VPN Endpoint V2. Set to true by default.
    enabled = ""

    # ike_identifier - (Optional) The Internet Key Exchange (IKE) ID. If you don't specify a value, the default value is the public IP address of the cloud gateway.
    ike_identifier = ""

    # require_perfect_forward_secrecy - (Optional) Boolean specifying whether Perfect Forward Secrecy is enabled. Set to true by default.
    require_perfect_forward_secrecy = ""

    # phase_one_settings - (Optional) Settings for the phase one protocol (IKE). Phase One Settings are detailed below.
    phase_one_settings = ""

    # phase_two_settings - (Optional) Settings for the phase two protocol (IPSEC). Phase Two Settings are detailed below.
    phase_two_settings = ""

    # tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the VPN Endpoint V2.
    tags = ""

    # lifetime - (Optional) IKE Lifetime in seconds.
    lifetime = ""

    # lifetime - (Optional) IPSEC Lifetime in seconds.
    lifetime = ""

    # local_gateway_ip_address - (Optional) Public IP Address of the Local Gateway.
    local_gateway_ip_address = ""

    # local_gateway_private_ip_address - (Optional) Private IP Address of the Local Gateway.
    local_gateway_private_ip_address = ""

    # uri - (Optional) The Uniform Resource Identifier for the VPN Endpoint V2.
    uri = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
opc-resource-vpn-endpoint-v2.description: The ``opc_compute_vpn_endpoint_v2`` resource creates and manages an VPN Endpoint V2 in an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic identity domain.
